title: Jennifer Aniston and Reese Witherspoon attend Morning Show premiere
text:
Petition to have them create their own actual morning show (Picture: Startraksphoto/Splash)

Jennifer Aniston and Reese Witherspoon served up a storm during the premiere of their new The Morning Show in New York City.

The two actresses are starring as talk show host in their new Apple TV+ show and they are taking their roles seriously.

Jennifer, 50, wore an oversized black blazer with a lacy black silk skirt like the best talk show host around.

Reese opted for a very ‘90s black dress paired with spotted black tights.

It is spooky season after all, everything’s got to be black.

The Legally Blonde actress plays an activist and journalist named Bradley who lands a role on a morning talk show with seasoned co-host Alex, played by Jennifer.

Not only do they star in the show alongside Steve Carell, the two are also executive producers on it.

The show circles around sexual harassment in the MeToo era (Picture: Kristina Bumphrey/StarPix/REX

Source: Rex Features)

They already have their journalist poses perfected (Picture: Janet Mayer/Startraksphoto.com)

This isn’t the first time the pals have worked together.

Reese played Jennifer’s spoiled little sister Jill on everyone’s favourite Friends.

Jennifer recently admitted she wanted to be as vulnerable as possible for the part, which is a world away from her usual comedic roles.

In the upcoming series, Alex is deemed ‘past her prime’ by all her male colleagues – something she found herself able to relate to.

‘I wanted to feel vulnerable,’ she said. ‘I wanted to show the raw, the messy, the unflattering.

Our favourite Green sisters (Picture: Steven Bergman/AFF-USA.COM)

‘This is a woman holding it together. One of the challenges for [my] character is the trauma and turmoil going on in her private life, and the toll that that takes on her emotionally, physically, mentally, versus the character that she is when she has to get up, put on a face and smile to America.’

Comparing her life to Alex, she added to the Daily Telegraph: ‘I can relate to that. Of course there are times when you don’t want anyone to see you, or you don’t want to be photographed or even go out of the house.

‘Nothing is as it seems in a glossy magazine.’

The Morning Show will be released on 1 November on AppleTV+.
